Leadenhall Market

Leadenhall Market is a covered market in the historic center of the City of London financial district. It is an ancient market that can be dated from the 14th century[1].

Creators: Diliff
Licence: CC BY-SA 3.0
Source Link: https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/File:Leadenhall_Market_In_London_-_Feb_2006_rotated.jpg

Leadenhall Market is one of the main locations for Diagon Alley in the Harry Potter film series.

Creators: Diego Delso
Licence: CC BY-SA 4.0
Source Link: https://commons.wikimedia.org/wiki/File:Mercado_Leadenhall,_Londres,_Inglaterra,_2014-08-07,_DD_049.JPG

In 《Harry Potter and the Philosopher's Stone》:

00:20:30: Hagrid takes Harry past Leadenhall Market and from the Leaky Cauldron into Diagon Alley to buy Harry's school supplies: wands, owls, etc.

Address: Gracechurch St, London EC3V 1LT, UK

Location Westminster Underground Station

Westminster station is located in central London, on the north bank of the Thames River.

The Hogwarts Express is a real train.

The Thames River is the second largest river in the UK and the longest river in the England.
